title: Organizational Culture Exploration and Career-Linked Project Through Pirate Culture Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational organizational culture theory, project-based learning experience, understanding of secondary education environments
context.additional_context: A course for pre-service and in-service teachers to develop competencies in analyzing mathematics curriculum-linked organizational culture and strengthen employment capabilities, exploring methods to apply historical cases to modern educational settings.

learning_goals: Analysis of the six organizational culture elements of pirate culture (Johnson & Scholes Cultural Web) to utilize as a diagnostic tool for educational settings.
Development of at least two strategies to apply identified organizational culture characteristics (from experiential learning activities) to mathematics classroom operations.
Preparation and presentation of a fit assessment report with potential educational institutions (employers) based on analysis results.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
